description: SCENT S.r.l (SemiConductor-based Electronic Network for Tumors) is a company whose mission is to design, test and manufacture medical devices for tumor screening and monitoring. These tools are composed by a core of nanostructured gas sensors that analyze the composition of gases produced by human organism that can be affected by volatile cancer biomarkers. Such screening methods are innovative with respect to the traditional ones with the advantage of being less invasive for the patient, efficient and economic. SCENT A1 is the first patented device (now in Italy, UK and Germany), capable of performing a non invasive colorectal cancer (CRC) preventive screening by the analysis of fecal exhalation. The clinical validation, started in May 2016, will be concluded by the end of 2019. This device will be able of improving the results of fecal occult blood test (FOBT) in the countries in which it is adopted by the national health service (e.g. Italy) and will be presented as a new preventive test on the population in those countries in which no screening methodology has yet been adopted. Thanks to this device a huge nuber of non operative colonoscopies due to FOBT false positives (more than 60%) will be avoided. The inclusion of this system will also increase the number of adhesions to screening system, due to the fear of undergoing colonoscopy. The second device, named SCENT B1 (Italian patent) is capable of performing a post-surgery monitoring on blood samples, to detect the presence of volatile tumor markers exhaled from localized neoplasms and/or from metastasis. By means of this device it is also possible to check the health status of cells, the degenerative state of a tumor tissue and efficacy of drugs, applied to bacterial cultures and neoplastic tissues.

Our core product is tiberCAD, a software for CAD applications in the field of electronic and optoelectronic devices. It allows to model and design innovative devices, such as organic and inorganic LEDs based on quantum wells and quantum dots, nanowire FETs, III/V heterostructures, dye-sensitized solar cells (DSC), taking in account the most important physical concepts emerging in the last developments of nanoelectronics and nanotechnology, such as quantum mechanical effects, strain and polarization in heterostructure semiconductor devices, self-heating and thermal transport. tiberCAD is a multiphysics tool, that is it is able to solve many different physical models involved in device simulation. It is also a multiscale tool, since it allows the simultaneous solution of physical models on different length scales. With tiberCAD, quantum and  classical descriptions can be used in different regions of a device/nanostructure within the same simulation. Analysis and optimization may be performed at all the relevant length scales, possibly including self-consistent coupling of different models, such as quantum/drift-diffusion, thermal/drift-diffusion. In particular, we investigate simulation models based on quantum approaches in an atomistic framework, such as Tight-binding and Density Functional Theory, and their coupling to continuous level models for transport and light generation

Horo is development, production and commercialization of an innovative active noise cancelling devices kit.
 Kit is composed by modules, which installed out of a window reduce incoming noise with both OPEN and CLOSED window.
 Horo works using ANC (active noise cancelling) technology trough three steps:
 1) listenign: thanks to little microphones Horo listen external noise, in particular it's phase.
 
 2) anti-noise creation: with ANC algorithm, modules take noise's phase and create its opposite
 
 3) noise reduction: speaker re-play first sound with this new phase, reducing original noise.
 
 modules are wired to home. In our ideal scenario modules works with solar powered batteries.
 
 No one in the market is provinding our user centered solutions.
 Sound blocking solutions are divided in two areas, passive and active solutions. passive solutions like foam layers, double glasses ecc are better for high frequences noise (high noise peaks, ecc). Instead, active solutions using ANC technology, are better for low frequency noises like traffic, voices, middle background noise and all noises created by a periodic element in movement (like engine, fan ecc).
 Already existing active solutions are working with closed window.
 No one is providing this open window benefit, ensuring a total domestic experience thanks to this running function.
 Horo is just composed just by hardware components in a simple
 parallelepiped case, being in this way also visually "invisible". 
 Horo is a modular kit, compatible with any kind of window (small, medium or big, glass window, doors ecc) it's just matter of place and install this modules wherever we want and let this invisible shield work. it could be applied in different scenarios:
 private & public spaces, hospitals, eco & zen-building, yacht and sail boats, offices, museums, coworking spaces and libraries...wherever silence could be necessary.
